documents.document: @siskey @GaRoDean @paolohughes @Motherfocloir @UCDLawSchool @HistoryHub_ie @BordnaGaeilge @UCDIrishStudies If you think about it, bunreacht is closer to European concept of a basic/fundamental law (e.g. Grundgesetz) & thus temporary in nature.
@KarrieKehoe Pedants gonna pedant. That someone would go to the hassle is more tragic than post-truth though.

@CaoimheNicD @Cooplafocal @IrishAesthete @davidhicksbook @IrishGeorgian @felixmlarkin Also JER didn’t spend a huge amount of time there. We was between Leeson Park Dublin & Wynnstay Gardens London mostly. However, he really loved Aughavannagh & tried to go as often as political schedules permitted. John Dillon once corresponded with him on what lawnmower to get.

@CaoimheNicD @Cooplafocal @IrishAesthete @davidhicksbook @IrishGeorgian My Granny lived there in the ‘30s. Said it was cold and isolated but she got great stories out of it. I’ll need to check my notes but Louis G Redmond Howard (of the GPB) lived there after JER. Not entirely clear on how it passed from CSP to JER. @felixmlarkin any info?

CO 904 is an indispensable source for anyone working on society, crime, land, or politics in Ireland 1880-1921. It’s also mad to think such a massive state surveillance operation was running for so long. MPs among those kept under police monitoring. https://t.co/FaszPa4wzK

@simoncoveney @HMcEntee @LaceyDermot @rtenews Fair play for replying. Definitely lessons learned. Hope 2 mics go in the crew's luggage the next time. 🎤🎤
RT @dfarchives: #OTD 1920. Auxillary RIC fire on spectators @CrokePark killing 14. Original ticket & cymbal dropped on pitch displayed in o…

@HMcEntee @LaceyDermot @rtenews That’s awful, I’d say you were raging. Watching at home we just assumed @simoncoveney was suffering from a bad dose of mansplaining. I hope you told them all it’s you’re getting the mic next time. It sent out a really bad message, especially to young people.

@LaceyDermot @rtenews Nah, it wasn’t any doughnut effect. She was stood right beside him as if she was about to be interviewed and then she was never asked a question or anything. Disappointing and really awkward to watch.

Did anyone else just see that mad interview on @rtenews where Helen McEntee stood silently beside Simon Coveney during a 5mins plus interview?? Is this the message we’re sending out: that women should be seen and not heard in Irish Politics?

UCD MA in #PublicHistory went to visit @CenturyIRL earlier today at @BCDublin. Great insights into workflow, special projects, anniversary culture, and managing a massive online history project. Thanks to Mark Duncan for a great session. #twitterstorians https://t.co/uryhc9Af1V
